Others: The Lakers lost to the Minnesota Timberwolves 124-107 in a preseason game.
The Lakers played without LeBron James and Anthony Davis, while the Timberwolves didn't have Anthony Edwards and Julius Randle.
JJ Redick, in his first game as the Lakers' coach, noted that the team was 'destroyed in the possession battle'.
The Lakers had 21 turnovers, five more than Minnesota's.
JJ Redick promised to run more sets with the Lakers and followed through with it in the game.
The Lakers kept running sets throughout the game, with players knowing their roles.
